Elevators

SUMMARY:  INNER | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL:  FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

elevator.rmi
Class MakeAll

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--elevator.rmi.MakeAll
public final class MakeAll
extends java.lang.Object

The MakeAll class provides class's methods for obtaining remote references (stubs) to the objects of the Elevators application, for adding event listeners interesting in receiving action events (action commands) from elevator's and floor buttons, for adding position listeners for monitoring positions of moving elevators and velocity listeners for monitoring changes of elevators' velocity. The references obtained can be used for controlling different components of the Elevators such as motors, doors, scales. Which interface to use depends on a level of granularity in a multithreaded application that controls Elevators. According to the typical in Java name convention, a static "getFoo" method of the MakeAll class returns a remote reference (a stub) with the "Foo" interface used to control a "foo" elevator component. For example, the getDoor(int number) method returns an RMI stub with the Door interface for controlling a door of the elevator with the given number. The getDoors() method returns an RMI stub with the Doors interface for controlling doors of all, a group or one elevator via one stub.

The MakeAll class allows obtaining references to remote objects with the following remote interfaces defined in the package:

MotorTo control a motor of one elevator: to start moving the elevator up or down, to stop the elevator and to test a current position of the elevator.
DoorTo control a door of one elevator: to open/close the door.
ScaleTo access a scale (level indicator) of one elevator: to set/get value of the scale.
ElevatorTo control all components (motor, door and scale) of one elevator. The interface extends Motor, Door and Scale
MotorsTo control motors of all elevators, a group of elevators, or one elevator.
DoorsTo control doors of all elevators, a group of elevators, or one elevator.
ScalesTo access scales of all elevators, a group of elevators, or one elevator.
ElevatorsTo control all components (motors, doors and scales of all elevators, a group of elevators or one elevator. The interface extends Motors, Doors and Scales

The MakeAll class also allows adding action listeners interesting in receiving action events (action commands) from the elevators' and floor buttons, and adding position listeners interested in monitoring positions of moving elevators. A listener class must implement the java.awt.event.ActionListener interface. The MakeAll class provides the following methods for adding action listeners:

addFloorListenerAdds ActionListener object(s) to receive events from floor buttons. An action command that comes with an event is "b f d", where "b" stands for "button", f is an integer number of the floor where the button was pressed, d is the direction, upwards or downwards, assigned to the button.
addInsideListenerAdds an ActionListener object(s) to receive events inside button panel(s). An action command that comes with an event is "p n f", where "p" stands for "panel", n is an integer number of the elevator cabin where the button was pressed, f is the integer floor number assigned to the button.
addPositionListenerAdds ActionListener object(s) for monitoring positions of elevator(s). When an elevator starts moving, listener(s) receives a sequence of action events carrying position values at a predefined rate of the elevators' Timer. An action command that comes with an action event is "f n p", where "f" stands for "floor units", n is the integer elevator number, p is a float value of the current position of the moving elevator. For example, "f 2 2.5" means that the 2nd elevator is (was?) exactly in between the 2nd and the 3rd floors.
addVelocityListenerAdds ActionListener object(s) for monitoring changes of the elevators' velocity that have been made by the velocity slider. An action command that comes with an action event is "v value", where "v" stands for "velocity", value is a float value of the current velocity set for elevators' motors in "floor units" per millisecond

To set the name of the host where the RMI registry is located and the number of the port on which the registry accepts calls, the init() static methods of the MakeAll class can be called once in the application, before calling any other methods of the class. Both the host name and the port number are optional parameters. If a host name is omitted, the name defaults to the local host. If a port number is omitted, then the number defaults to the registry default port number 1099. For example: 

 public class Control extends Thread implements ActionListener {
   Motor motor;
   Door door;
   Scale scale;
   Elevators elevators;
  public Control() {
  }
  public void run() {
   try {
     MakeAll.init("localhost"); // actually not needed for localhost
     MakeAll.addFloorListener(this);
     MakeAll.addInsideListener(this);
     // monitor position of 3rd elevator
     MakeAll.addPositionListener(3, this);
     motor =MakeAll.getMotor(1);
     scale = MakeAll.getScale(1);
     door = MakeAll.getDoor(1);
     for (int i = 2; i >= 0; i--) {
       door.open();
       sleep(2000);
       door.close();
       sleep(3000);
     }
     elevators = MakeAll.getElevators();
     elevators.up();
     sleep(3000);
     elevators.stop();
     sleep(3000);
     elevators.down();
   } catch (Exception e) {
     e.printStackTrace();
     System.exit(1);
   }
     Object obj = new Object();
   synchronized (obj) {
     try { wait(); } catch (Exception e) {}
   }
  }
  public static void main(String[] args) {
   Control control1 = new Control();
   control1.start();
  }
  public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
   System.out.println(e.getActionCommand());
  }
 }

Version:

Method Detail

addFloorListener

public static void addFloorListener(java.awt.event.ActionListener[] listener)
                             throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                    IllegalParamException,
                                    java.net.MalformedURLException,
                                    java.rmi.NotBoundException
Adds an array of ActionListener to receive events from all floor buttons. All listeners receive an action event when a floor button is pressed. An action command that comes with the event is "b f d" where "b" stands for "button", f is the integer number of the floor where the button was pressed, d is an integer code of the direction ("-1" means downwards, "1" means upwards) assigned to the button.
Parameters:
listener - ActionListener to be added.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if failed to add the listener
java.net.MalformedURLException - if the URL of the Elevators proxy object (getALL) is not an appropriately formatted URL.
java.rmi.NotBoundException - is failed to obtain a reference to the getAll
IllegalParamException - if listener is null

Adds a group of ActionListener to receive events from inside panel buttons located in a given elevator. A listener receives an action event when a button is pressed inside the elevator. An action command that comes with the event is "p n f" where "p" stands for "panel", n is the integer number of the elevator where the button was pressed, f is an integer floor number assigned to the button. For the Stop button f = Elevators.SPECIAL_FOR_STOP, i.e. 32000.

number - The integer number of the elevator where the button panel is located

When the velocity has changed by the velocity gauge, the listener receives an action events carrying current value of the velocity. getDoor

public static Door getDoor(int number)
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                           IllegalParamException,
                           java.net.MalformedURLException,
                           java.rmi.NotBoundException
Returns an object with the Door interface which is used for controlling a door of the elevator with the given number.
Parameters:
number - An integer number of elevator whose Door to get.
Returns:
An object with the Door interface.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if failed to get an Door object.
IllegalParamException - if number is not a legal elevator number.
java.net.MalformedURLException - if the URL of the Elevators proxy object (getALL) is not an appropriately formatted URL.
java.rmi.NotBoundException - is failed to obtain a reference to the getAll
See Also:
Door

                      throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                             IllegalParamException,
                             java.net.MalformedURLException,

Returns:

getElevator

public static Elevator getElevator(int number)
                            throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                   IllegalParamException,
                                   java.net.MalformedURLException,
                                   java.rmi.NotBoundException
Returns an object with the Elevator interface that is used for controlling all components (the motor, the door, and the scale) of the elevator with the given number via Java RMI.
Parameters:
number - The integer number of elevator whose Elevator to get.
Returns:
An object with the Elevator interface.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if failed to get an Elevator object.
IllegalParamException - if number is not a legal elevator number.
java.net.MalformedURLException - if the URL of the Elevators proxy object (getALL) is not an appropriately formatted URL.
java.rmi.NotBoundException - is failed to obtain a reference to the getAll
See Also:
Elevator

                                     IllegalParamException,
                                     java.net.MalformedURLException,
                                     java.rmi.NotBoundException

init

public static void init()
                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                        java.net.MalformedURLException,
                        java.rmi.NotBoundException
Initializes the MakeAll class that provide RMI access to the Elevators application. The RMI registry host defaults to "localhost". The RMI registry port defaults to 1099.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if failed contact the rmi registry.
java.net.MalformedURLException - if the name of the Elevators proxy object is not an appropriately formatted URL.
java.rmi.NotBoundException - if failed to get a reference to the Elevators proxy object

init

public static void init(int port)
                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                        java.net.MalformedURLException,
                        java.rmi.NotBoundException
Initializes the MakeAll class that provide RMI access to the Elevators application. The RMI registry host defaults to "localhost".
Parameters:
port - The number of the port on which the RMI registry accepts calls.
Throws:

java.net.MalformedURLException - if the name of the Elevators proxy object is not an appropriately formatted URL.
java.rmi.NotBoundException - if failed to get a reference to the Elevators proxy object

                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                        java.net.MalformedURLException,
                        java.rmi.NotBoundException
Initializes the MakeAll class that provide RMI access to the Elevators application. The RMI registry port defaults to 1099.
Parameters:
host - A name of the host where the RMI registry is located
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if failed contact the rmi registry.
java.net.MalformedURLException - if the name of the Elevators proxy object is not an appropriately formatted URL.
java.rmi.NotBoundException - if failed to get a reference to the Elevators proxy object

                        int port)
                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                        java.net.MalformedURLException,
                        java.rmi.NotBoundException
Initializes the MakeAll class that provide RMI access to the Elevators application.
Parameters:
host - A name of the host where the RMI registry is located
port - The number of the port on which the RMI registry accepts calls.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if failed contact the rmi registry.
java.net.MalformedURLException - if the name of the Elevators proxy object is not an appropriately formatted URL.
java.rmi.NotBoundException - if failed to get a reference to the Elevators proxy object
